alert.note: Alert for Kent; Providence (Rhode Island) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued September 05 at 4:31PM EDT until September 05 at 5:30PM EDT by NWS Boston
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 530 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON FOR NORTHERN KENT AND SOUTHERN PROVIDENCE COUNTIES... At 431 PM EDT, Doppler radar continued to indicate heavy rain in southern Providence county from south Foster to Providence and Cranston. Between 3 and 6 inches of rain have fallen in about 2 hours. Life threatening Flash flooding is already occurring. While rainfall rates have diminished, heavy rain will continue during the next 1-2 hours. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Heavy rain producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Providence, Warwick, Cranston, East Providence, Coventry, West Warwick, Johnston, Barrington, Seekonk, Scituate and Foster. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
